current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To ensure that individuals who attempted to, or who are enrolled in, qualified health plans offered through an Exchange have continuity of coverage and to require Exchanges to make coverage under qualified health plans retroactive to January 1, 2014.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Authority to provide timely coverage for individuals who were unable to enroll in a qualified health plan

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall require that the issuer of the plan treat such individual as enrolled in such plan as of December 23, 2013, if the following conditions are met:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text: In the case of an individual who enrolls in a qualified health plan offered through an Exchange established under

text.#text: The individual submits, not later than January 31, 2014, an attestation (in such form and manner as the
made reasonable, good-faith attempts, but was unable, to successfully enroll in such a plan through an Exchange before December 23, 2013; or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: but is not eligible to so enroll in such a Medicaid plan and, because of such incorrect eligibility determination, was subsequently unable to enroll in a qualified health plan before December 23, 2013.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: title XIX of the Social Security Act

text.#text:
The individual pays to the health insurance issuer issuing the qualified health plan in which such individual is enrolled (either directly or through the Exchange) any applicable premiums owed by such individual for enrollment in the plan taking into account the amount of
any premium assistance made available under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1311(c) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:c

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall permit a State, at the option of the State, to make coverage under a qualified health plan retroactive to January 1, 2014, with respect to an individual who enrolls in such plan through the State Exchange (or the Federal Exchange in the case of a State that has not established a State Exchange) during the period established by the State under
.  Any health care items or services provided to such enrollee in January of 2014 shall be covered retroactively under the plan as if the enrollee had been enrolled on January 1 of such year.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311/ss:c/p:7/sp:B

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the

The period established under this subparagraph shall be the period beginning on December 23, 2013, and ending on a date determined by the State, but in no event later than January 31, 2014, except that a State that has an enrollment deadline that is prior to December 23, 2013, may modify the period under this subparagraph to encompass such deadline.

Transitional use of receipt of insurance payment as alternative to health insurance card for Exchange plans

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall require a health insurance issuer that offers a qualified health plan through an Exchange under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services
title I of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/t:I

text.#text: to allow in-network providers in such plan to treat, for purposes of coverage under the plan, a receipt of payment of premiums by an individual enrolled under the plan for January or February 2014 who has not received a health insurance card from the issuer in the same manner as if such receipt were such a health insurance card issued to such individual by the issuer for services furnished during such month; and
to notify such in-network providers of the policy under

Nothing in this section shall be construed as precluding a health care provider from directly seeking to verify the status of the enrollment of an individual in a qualified health plan offered through an Exchange by contacting the Exchange or the issuer of such plan.
